channel.title: Posts on ET et Sidus
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on ET et Sidus

item.title: Supervised Learning
item.description: What is Supervise Learning? Supervised learning uses labelled training data to learn the mapping function turning input variables (X) into output (Y). Focusing on Classification and Regression Classification: Predict sample’s type or category, such as identify something/type. Regression: Predict a real value, such as predict housing price in somewhere. Options: SVM, Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, NB, LDA, DT, kNN, NN.

item.title: My Hugo site Plan
item.description: Reasons to use this site In general, as a Health Data Analyst and current research student in the field of public health informatics (epidemiology), I have full interests in terms of data science related programming languages and skills, therefore I wanna build a free online blog site to record all experiences, error message and others. This Hugo blog is the first stage, next stage is Django skill that I am actually learning now.

item.title: How to select a Machine Learning algorithm
item.description: At First - Algorithms for an ML beginner This post is mainly written for ML beginners (ie., myself). It is really confused to select an appropriate algorithm for any current case. ML algorithms can be generally divided into Supervised learning, Unsupervised learning, Semi-Supervised learning and Reinforcement. Supervised Learning Supervised learning uses labelled training data to learn the mapping function turning input variables (X) into output (Y). Focusing on Classification and Regression

item.title: How to install m10c theme.
item.description: Your m10c theme from ZERO to one This is a short tutorial to help us building a Hugo blog with m10c theme. This memo has four parts as following:Part 1 - Pre tools setting Part 2 - Build a Hugo framework Part 3 - Host on GitHub Part 4 - Final Step Part 5 - Real Final Step Reference

item.title: How to post Hugo content
item.description: How to post a Hugo markdown AND Chinese Testing 中文測試 How to post a Hugo content Step 1: To enter into your blog root folder, ie, ‘blog’ in my case: $ cd hugo $ hugo Step 2: create a new post(markdown format title.md) by $ hugo new post/title.md And then please your familiar text editor to complete your content writing and save. My favourite editor for GitHub writing is Atom IDE and Vim command line.
